Posted By: Sixty3Zero (9/14/2010 10:06:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think lil' Jace actually still has some playability in standard. He's not Mind Sculptor, true, but he does have a few significant advantages over big jace:  
  
1. He costs 1 less. This is actually pretty significant, as mind sculptor competes with lots of other good 4 drops- like Day of Judgement.  
  
2. His +2 does something for you immediately. Fatesealing just isn't that good, and you almost always need to do it immediately to put big jace out of lightning bolt range. The howling mine effect is, in most cases, superior for the control decks that tend to play jace.  
  
3. His final ability is easier to activate. It costs less, and it's just easier to protect jace long enough for him to 'go off' with a constant howling mine effect than it is to protect a constant fateseal.  
  
4. He doesn't cost 80$ a pop.
posts.html:
I think lil' Jace actually still has some playability in standard. He's not Mind Sculptor, true, but he does have a few significant advantages over big jace:

1. He costs 1 less. This is actually pretty significant, as mind sculptor competes with lots of other good 4 drops- like Day of Judgement.

2. His +2 does something for you immediately. Fatesealing just isn't that good, and you almost always need to do it immediately to put big jace out of lightning bolt range. The howling mine effect is, in most cases, superior for the control decks that tend to play jace.

3. His final ability is easier to activate. It costs less, and it's just easier to protect jace long enough for him to 'go off' with a constant howling mine effect than it is to protect a constant fateseal.

4. He doesn't cost 80$ a pop.

posts.post_content:
When combined with [Consecrated Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consecrated Sphinx), this guy, while still probably not quite up to JMS standards, got a whole hell of a lot better. +2: your opponent draws 1 and you draw 3 (+2 more for every other opponent)? Yes please! He can't bounce and you need to get the sphinx out, but if you're netting 3 cards a turn by turn 6 - just two after you could drop Big Jace - is that really going an insurmountable disadvantage for blue control? (Maybe it is; I honestly don't know.) Basically, it's a question between a reusable turn 4 [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm)/[Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon) - turn 5 if you need to get him unboltable - or turn 6 reusable [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall). (Oh, hello [Arcanis the Omnipotent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanis the Omnipotent). Welcome back to Standard.)

*"In my opinion the worst Planeswalker ever printed.  
In 95% of all cases he is just a better Temple Bell.  
Better Temple Bell in the way that your enemy draws cards but only every thi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)*

posts.post_content:
In my opinion the worst Planeswalker ever printed.  
In 95% of all cases he is just a better [Temple Bell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temple Bell).  
Better [Temple Bell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temple Bell) in the way that your enemy draws cards but only every third turn rather than each turn.  
  
Most resolved Ultimates from the other Planeswalkers mean you allmost won. Or at least those are real win conditions. Your Enemy has drawn at least four cards to until you can finally use Jace Belerens ultimate.  
  
There are only two reasons why this card sees any play:   
1.Because he's a [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate) vs the real Jace  
 and   
2. Because one deck type utilizes what would be a disadvantage in any other deck: Force your enemy to draw. But neither is Turbofog that good atm nor means it the card is good.  
[Scornful Egotist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scornful Egotist) is also utter crap as a card but has it's uses because of it's disadvantage.
posts.html:
In my opinion the worst Planeswalker ever printed.
In 95% of all cases he is just a better Temple Bell.
Better Temple Bell in the way that your enemy draws cards but only every third turn rather than each turn.

Most resolved Ultimates from the other Planeswalkers mean you allmost won. Or at least those are real win conditions. Your Enemy has drawn at least four cards to until you can finally use Jace Belerens ultimate.

There are only two reasons why this card sees any play:
1.Because he's a Vindicate vs the real Jace
and
2. Because one deck type utilizes what would be a disadvantage in any other deck: Force your enemy to draw. But neither is Turbofog that good atm nor means it the card is good.
Scornful Egotist is also utter crap as a card but has it's uses because of it's disadvantage.
